cellularAutomata.artificialLife.fitness
Class ZeroFitnessFunction

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.artificialLife.fitness.ZeroFitnessFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
FitnessFunction
public class ZeroFitnessFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements FitnessFunction

Evaluates a critter to see if it is holding a reasonable value for 0.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Summary
ZeroFitnessFunction()
          Create an evaluator of critters that gives highest fitness to critters with chromosomes that map to 0.
 
Method Summary
 double evaluateFitness(Phenotype phenotype)
          Evaluates the fitness of the specified critter (phenotype) assigning the highest value to chromosomes that map to 0.
 double getChromosomeValue(Phenotype phenotype)
          Extracts the estimation of 0 represented by the phenotype's chromosome.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Create an evaluator of critters that gives highest fitness to critters with chromosomes that map to 0.

Method Detail

evaluateFitness

public double evaluateFitness(Phenotype phenotype)
Evaluates the fitness of the specified critter (phenotype) assigning the highest value to chromosomes that map to 0.

evaluateFitness in interface FitnessFunction

getChromosomeValue

public double getChromosomeValue(Phenotype phenotype)
Extracts the estimation of 0 represented by the phenotype's chromosome.

Parameters:
phenotype - The phenotype whose fitness is being evaluated.
Returns:
The chromosome's approximation to 0.
